servinfo.title: Exhaust Manifold Removal and Installation

attention1.ptxt: To avoid danger of being burned, do not service exhaust system while it is still hot. Service should be performed after system has cooled off.

s1.ptxt: Remove battery and battery tray.
Remove air cleaner assembly and air cleaner outlet hose.
Remove A/F sensor connector (1) and HO2S connector (2) (if equipped) from bracket, then disconnect them.
For RHD model, remove steering lower shaft assembly referring to Steering Lower Shaft Assembly Removal and Installation .
If equipped with EGR system, disconnect EGR pipe (3) from exhaust manifold.
Remove exhaust manifold cover.
Remove exhaust No.1 pipe.
Remove exhaust manifold stiffener (1).
Remove exhaust manifold (1) and its gasket from cylinder head.
Release fuel pressure in fuel feed line referring to Fuel Pressure Relief Procedure .
Disconnect negative (–) cable at battery.
Disconnect fuel feed hose (1) and fuel return hose (2).
Disconnect brake booster hose (1), vacuum tank hose (2) and EVAP canister purge valve hose (3) from intake manifold and fuel No.2 pipe (4).
Disconnect vacuum hose from IMT valve, and remove vacuum tank assembly.
For LHD model, remove steering lower shaft assembly referring to Steering Lower Shaft Assembly Removal and Installation .
Disconnect suction hose and discharge hose from A/C compressor referring to Compressor Assembly Removal and Installation .
Remove oil filter referring to Engine Oil and Filter Change .
Remove A/F sensor connector (1) and HO2S connector (2) (if equipped) from bracket, then disconnect them.
Remove engine hook (1).
Remove oil level gauge (2) and oil level gauge guide (3).
Remove exhaust manifold cover (4).
Remove exhaust No.1 pipe.
Remove exhaust manifold stiffener (1).
Remove exhaust manifold (1) and its gasket from cylinder head.

servinfosub.title: Installation
servinfosub.ptxt: Reverse removal procedure for installation noting the following.

item.ptxt: Use new gaskets and seal rings.
Always install new exhaust manifold bolts (1) with pre-coated adhesive.
Tighten each bolts and nuts to specified torque.

torqueitem.t-part: Exhaust No.1 pipe bolt and nut

item.ptxt: For RHD model, install steering lower shaft assembly referring to Steering Lower Shaft Assembly Removal and Installation .
Upon completion of installation, start engine and check that no exhaust gas leakage exists.

servinfo.ptxt: Reverse removal procedure for installation noting the following.

item.ptxt: Use new gaskets and seal rings.
Always install new exhaust manifold bolts (1) with pre-coated adhesive.
Tighten each bolts and nuts to specified torque.

torqueitem.t-part: Exhaust No.1 pipe bolt and nut

item.ptxt: Install oil filter referring to Engine Oil and Filter Change .
Connect suction hose and discharge hose to A/C compressor referring to Compressor Assembly Removal and Installation .
For LHD model, install steering lower shaft assembly referring to Steering Lower Shaft Assembly Removal and Installation .
Upon completion of installation, turn ignition switch to ON position and check that no fuel leakage.
Start engine and check that no exhaust gas leakage.
